dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: HAHAHAHAHAHA! Are they serious with this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: HAHAHAHAHAHA! Are they serious with this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, believe me, they are. It’s... it's quite a move, A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, believe me, they are. It's... it's quite a move, A.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But linking housing tariffs to the monthly calculation index? Like, what does that even mean? My head just kinda exploded reading that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But linking housing tariffs to the monthly calculation index? Like, what does that even mean? My head just kinda exploded reading that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, the core idea, right, is to kinda bypass those really long, drawn-out approval processes at the local maslikhat level.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, the core idea, right, is to kinda bypass those really long, drawn-out approval processes at the local maslikhat level.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The draft law on housing and utilities discusses linking housing maintenance tariffs to the monthly calculation index (MCI) to avoid lengthy approvals at the maslikhat level.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Maslikhats? Oh, the city councils, kinda? Yeah, those are slow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maslikhats? Oh, the city councils, kinda? Yeah, those are slow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Right now, they approve all the housing maintenance tariffs, but it's, like, incredibly slow. And then, when they do try to raise them, people get really upset.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Right now, they approve all the housing maintenance tariffs, but it's, like, incredibly slow. And then, when they do try to raise them, people get really upset.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the deputy, housing maintenance tariffs are currently approved by maslikhats, but the process is slow. Tariff increases often cause public dissatisfaction, leading regional authorities to either delay their revision or not review them at all, complicating the maintenance of apartment buildings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that makes sense. Who wants to pay more, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that makes sense. Who wants to pay more, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, regional authorities just... they either delay reviewing them or they just don't review them at all. Which then complicates, um, maintaining apartment buildings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, regional authorities just... they either delay reviewing them or they just don't review them at all. Which then complicates, um, maintaining apartment buildings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tariff increases often cause public dissatisfaction, leading regional authorities to either delay their revision or not review them at all, complicating the maintenance of apartment buildings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, because it's so painful for them to raise prices, the buildings just fall apart? Uh, that's bad.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, because it's so painful for them to raise prices, the buildings just fall apart? Uh, that's bad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. So, by linking it to the MCI, the deputy, Smyshlyayeva, she says it’ll be automatically indexed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. So, by linking it to the M C I, the deputy, Smyshlyayeva, she says it'll be automatically indexed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That™s why we are discussing linking the tariff to the MCI so that it is automatically indexed, allowing maslikhats to avoid revisiting this issue for several years," the deputy said during a Majilis session.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Automatically indexed? So, no more, like, big public fights every time?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Automatically indexed? So, no more, like, big public fights every time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. The maslikhats won't have to revisit it for years, which, um, apparently, helps preserve the housing stock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. The maslikhats won't have to revisit it for years, which, um, apparently, helps preserve the housing stock.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "We understand that, in addition to management, preserving the housing stock is also important. That™s why we are discussing linking the tariff to the MCI so that it is automatically indexed, allowing maslikhats to avoid revisiting this issue for several years," the deputy said during a Majilis session.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But what about, like, different buildings? My building is, uh, way older than yours. Should we pay the same?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But what about, like, different buildings? My building is, uh, way older than yours. Should we pay the same?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, that's the other big part of the proposal. They're going to introduce coefficients based on quality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, that's the other big part of the proposal. They're going to introduce coefficients based on quality.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The draft law also proposes considering housing quality when determining tariffs. Specifically, coefficients will be introduced based on factors such as the building's age, the presence of technical facilities, and other characteristics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Coefficients? What's that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Coefficients? What's that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Like, factors. Building age, if it has good technical facilities, other characteristics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like, factors. Building age, if it has good technical facilities, other characteristics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically, coefficients will be introduced based on factors such as the building's age, the presence of technical facilities, and other characteristics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they'll just, um, decide these things? We don't get to vote on that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they'll just, um, decide these things? We don't get to vote on that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. Those coefficients, they'll be included in the minimum tariff by default. No resident voting required for that basic structure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. Those coefficients, they'll be included in the minimum tariff by default. No resident voting required for that basic structure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These coefficients will be included in the minimum tariff by default and will not require residents™ voting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. So, what do we get to vote on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. So, what do we get to vote on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Only additional services. If you want something extra, then that’ll still need a general vote of the homeowners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only additional services. If you want something extra, then that'll still need a general vote of the homeowners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, additional services, if needed, will be approved by a general vote of homeowners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Man, that's... that's a lot. Sounds like they're just trying to streamline it, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, that's... that's a lot. Sounds like they're just trying to streamline it, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the goal. They're doing, uh, significant work to improve the whole tariff-setting system, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the goal. They're doing, uh, significant work to improve the whole tariff-setting system, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Smyshlyayeva added that significant work is currently underway to improve the tariff-setting system in the housing and utilities sector.
